learning_outcomes.description: Describe a variety of modern cryptographic systems.
Explain how cryptographic primitives can be assembled, with appropriate protocols, for use in real-world applications.
Explain how practical and implementation concerns affect the ways in which modern cryptographic systems are designed.
Describe a variety of attacks that have been historically successful against modern cryptographic tools.
Explain how cryptographic systems can be redesigned or hardened to prevent against different types of attacks.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Revision week(23 Feb - 07 Jun)
learning_activities.topic:
Reading and homework problems

Before and after each lecture and applied class you are expected to be reading text and other suggested sources for deeper understanding of the material, and trying all homework problems set. This is essential to understand and pass this course - lectures and applied classes alone will not teach you everything you need to know, and you are expected to be self-learners in this course.
